summary:
Nathalie Houtermans is an experienced curator and art & culture theorist with a specialisation in developing interdisciplinary art projects in art institutions, as well as on unusual locations. She developed projects and curated exhibitions in Rotterdam, Amsterdam, The Hague, Sao Paulo, New York, Havana, Shanghai, Djakarta, Cape Town and Mumbai.

She has a broad knowledge about several art disciplines and their specific work processes. Although her main background is visual arts, she also worked with digital, video and performance artists, choreographers/dancers, architects, (graphic) designers, composers/musicians and writers. She produced new, site specific works with these artists herself.

Besides working with other artists as mentioned above, her own art practice consists of being a musician. Again, in this capacity she not only works with other musicians, but also with other artists to create visual works as part of the experience of the music.

She is an experienced tutor and mentor for students on an academic level, especially for art and culture and/or theory related studies. She is specialised in tutoring neurodiverse and other students with specific needs.

She is a researcher with an elaborate formal education and experience, which she combines with her work practice in a unique way. Over the years she not only could gather a thorough theoretical knowledge about the position(s) of western art and culture as wel as societies in other parts of the world, but also implements this knowledge in the development of new art projects and cultural organisations.

She has been a pioneer in setting up flexible organisations specialised in developing temporary projects in public space and other non-art locations, with a focus on presenting high quality, 'difficult', art works to a broad audience. 
She knows how to communicate art works on all levels for all target groups and is particularly interested in reaching an audience that has not been introduced to contemporary art yet. She knows what actually works and what absolutely not works regarding projects in public space, but keeps on exploring other approaches.

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

certifications.name: The American South: Its Stories, Music, and Art

company.name: Willem de Kooning Academy, University for Applied Sciences, Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: Willem de Kooning Academy, University for Applied Sciences, Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
Willem de Kooning Academy Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences is a leading international academy for bachelor and master degrees in media, art, design, leisure and education. The research tutor Autonomous Practices, minor Public & Private, guides 4th year students through their research and the writing of a research document in preparation of their final exams.

In addition, I tutor neurodiverse and other students with specific needs of all departments as a research tutor as well as a practice tutor.
profile_positions.title: Research Tutor Autonomous Practices

profile_positions.description:
Singer/songwriter of experimental noise and rock music with band and/or temporary collaborations since 1990. Current band: Katie Kruel (stoner/doom metal). Previous collaborations a/o: Oh My Goddess (punk blues), Salo Mortale & Unit Moebius (low fi techno), Iconoclast (psych punk).

Website: katiekruel.net
profile_positions.title: Singer / songwriter

profile_positions.description:
Freelance (selection) previous:
* External jury member at Willem de Kooning Academy, Rotterdam
* Artistic/productional advisor of 'Haperende Mens' since 2014 (exhibitions, festivals, based in Amsterdam)
* Co-curator of the Dutch entry of the 24th Biennial of Sao Paulo, Brazil
* Curator of various exhibitions in the Netherlands with international artists such as chaine-keten-chain (exhibitions on three locations with artists of 9 different nationalities)
* Lectures on an international level a/o for the Erasmus University Studium Generale, Rotterdam, Netherlands; P.S. 1, New York U.S.A.; International Filmfestival in Split, Croatia, 
* Guestlecturer of a course on art & culture theory at Fontys School of Fine and Performing arts in Tilburg, Netherlands 
* Lecturer/coach of interdisciplinary projects developed in situ on various locations in Tilburg with students of Fontys School of Fine and Performing arts in Tilburg, Netherlands
* Workshops in collaboration with (a/o) Gallery Green (Todd Pavlisko), Tim Rollins & K.O.S. and T.O.D.T. in New York, U.S.A.
* Essays published in national/international catalogues and magazines
* Radio interviews national/local radio stations on (a/o) Andres Serrano; art and violence; curating in public space; 
* Moderator for discussion panels about fashion, digital art, art in public space.
profile_positions.title: Art & culture theorist / curator / essayist

profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
Sandberg Instituut is the postgraduate department of the Gerrit Rietveld Academie Amsterdam. Dirty Art Department is one of its Master’s programmes. Although it comes from a background of applied art/ design, which flirts with the world of the pure (or fine) arts, its goal is to create singular practices which are much broader than these categories. 

The coordinator is the organisational and financial backbone of the department.

website: sandberg.nl
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Dirty Art Department

profile_positions.description:
New Horizons Festival is a festival on science, art and music on the occasion of the European Researchers Night. 

I curated an interdisciplinary mix of installations and performances, and initiated the production of new works around the central theme of the 2014 festival: Big Data. Works by internationally known digital media artists such as Geert Mul & Michel Banabila and Marnix de Nijs, but also by young artists like upcoming choreographer Maria Metsalu.

Website: www.newhorizonsfestival.nl/nhf_programma/big-data-poetry/
profile_positions.title: Curator Art Program

profile_positions.description:
Sensational Mix was an art initiative in the South of Rotterdam formed by Nathalie Houtermans and international curator Roland Groenenboom. Rotterdam Zuid is considered to be the 'worst part'​ of the Netherlands. Sensational Mix wanted to do justice to the cultural potential of Rotterdam Zuid by realising noteworthy international art projects in this part of the city. The projects focus on the specific social context of Zuid, from which the projects are developed. Next to art buffs, the aim was to bring people from other contexts in contact with the work of international artists that are invited to offer the visitor an unbiased view on Rotterdam Zuid through their work.

Sensational Mix had to stop due to a move abroad of Roland Groenenboom, but there might be Sensational Mix projects on occasion.

Website: sensationalmix.nl
profile_positions.title: Co-founder / co-director / curator / art theorist

profile_positions.description: Noname consisted of a gallery space in Rotterdam and a building with artist studios. It published catalogues and developed projects for companies and other institutions. It existed until 2008 (the last two years as Berendsen Gallery)
profile_positions.title: Interim director
